etymology.description: 树(shù) + 叶(yè) = leaves of a tree.
etymology.interpretation: Specifies leaves that grow on trees, highlighting the foliage as part of a tree. Common in everyday and literary contexts, especially for seasonal imagery.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified to reduce strokes: 樹 → 树 kept the 木 ‘tree’ radical and replaced the complex right-side phonetic; 葉 → 叶 dropped the 艹 ‘grass’ radical and simplified the phonetic component, making a high-frequency word faster to write.

parts.english: tree; to plant; to set up; to establish

examples.chinese: 秋天(秋天)，树叶变黄了(樹葉變黃了)。
examples.english: In autumn, the tree leaves turn yellow.

examples.chinese: 风吹动树叶(風吹動樹葉)，沙沙作响(沙沙作響)。
examples.english: The wind moves the tree leaves, making a rustling sound.

examples.chinese: 我们在地上捡树叶做标本(我們在地上撿樹葉做標本)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài dìshang jiǎn shùyè zuò biāoběn.
examples.english: We picked up tree leaves from the ground to make specimens.
